title: Two new Tiers has been introduced: Iron & Grandmaster elo
body:
https://images2.imgbox.com/af/f8/ZMm4mvUl_o.jpg

It's not a joke. They're literally adding a tier **below Bronze**. 

So I guess being Silver isn't such a bad thing now.

replies.body: Why putting Grandmaster if people can even make it that high? This is nonsense. Or Iron, why putting a even lower tier? It's like Silver is "gold" now.

Well everything evens out by plat 4 now which is interesting lol.

Iron 3 - Bronze 4

This idiotic ranked system is seriously the worst fucking shit ever.
won 4 out of 8 games with very very bad teams , now got placed in this fucking iron elo (2) and ONLY getting feeding teams.
Like not one lane but 2/3 , with people going pantheon support (10 farm , 3-4 K/D , then afking).
Please Rito fix this fucking mess and place people where they should be placed.
A thats what Im talking about my boy iron the new gold.

>So I guess being Silver isn't such a bad thing now.

Until all the Silver players on the boards end up scaling down to Bronze and throw the worlds biggest fit. No one likes looking at themselves in a mirror that shows them what they really look like.

The whole point of his new ranking system is to better separate skill levels that may overlap. I can tell you without a doubt that most silver 5/4/3 players don't belong in silver (or gold).
How can you not belong in silver? there is not a whole lot of room to go further down, that's like saying oww sheesh this guy is really bad for bronze 5 duh.

Most people who do ranked for the first time end up in Silver. If you've had to climb through the sludge that is Silver, you'd know a lot of people in Silver don't belong there and are just floundering on better players that carry them. It's like when you're driving down a road, and a plastic grocery bag follows your wake. Just because the plastic bag is traveling down the road with the other cars, doesn't mean it's moving on it's own.

It's still a fucking bronze plastic bag getting moved along by the vehicles winning their games for them.

Should've put a tier between bronze and Silver, and between Plat/Diamond. 

"Diamond 5 players and Diamond 1 players are too different. So we're putting a new tier in above Master."
That makes absolutely no sense, imo. How does putting a tier above Master help distinguish the people who _can't reach Master in the first place_, from the people who made it _out of platinum but aren't as good as the people in high Diamond_? Would make a lot more sense, again, from how I see it, to make Diamond harder to reach in the first place so the players in it have proven their skill and those not good enough for Diamond end up in hardstuck **Titanium III** players. 
That and, Bronze has to be below Iron if they want to use that name. Old Bronze changed to Iron tier, new Bronze tier added below Iron. 

or ... call it Wood or Tin and put it below Bronze.
